definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他興致勃勃地揭發政敵的貪污腐化。

sentences.english: Bill must have grassed on us.
sentences.chinese: 比爾一定檢舉揭發了我們。

sentences.english: Shixian and Wuji get the news and plan to expose Yingming's misdeed.
sentences.chinese: 世賢和戊己得到消息，準備揭發英明的罪行。

sentences.english: The corrupt official bought off those who might expose him.
sentences.chinese: 那名接受賄賂的官員收買了那些可能會揭發他的人。

sentences.english: In the survey, will expose right outside a woman forever.
sentences.chinese: 在衆人調查下，終揭發永權在外面有女人。

sentences.english: The central government has been cautiously encouraging a sudden burst in food safety muckraking.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府對揭發食品安全事故表示歡迎。

sentences.english: They laid open to him the whole scheme of the conspirators.
sentences.chinese: 他們向他揭發了陰謀分子的整個計劃。

sentences.english: I happily exposed the culprit and rushed outside.
sentences.chinese: 我高興地揭發了犯人後衝到了外面。

sentences.english: Ch'eng-Huang also exposes evil-doers in the community itself, usually through dreams.
sentences.chinese: 城王也在社區中揭露作惡者，通常是通過夢來揭發。

sentences.english: The young reporter muckrakes at every opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的記者不放過揭發貪污腐化現象的任何機會。

sentences.english: That newspaper story blew the lid off the Senator’s illegal business deals.
sentences.chinese: 報紙的報道揭發了參議員的非法勾當。

sentences.english: He has simply been exposed as an adulterer and a fool.
sentences.chinese: 有人揭發他就是個姦夫和白癡。

sentences.english: More nests of conspirators and saboteurs have been uncovered.
sentences.chinese: 更多陰謀者和破壞者的巢穴被揭發。

sentences.english: But I was unwilling to disclose anybody and Luo Xiaosi was good to me.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不能揭發別人，羅小四和我也不錯。

sentences.english: They point to how software has made it easier to uncover plagiarism.
sentences.chinese: 他們指的是軟件能夠更容易地揭發剽竊行爲。

sentences.english: Jiang Jin drugs by the media exposure, the heat of day lose faith in his son.
sentences.chinese: 蔣進吸毒一事遭傳媒揭發，盛怒的承天不再信任兒子。

definition: to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to set on fire/to commit arson
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
